text:p.text:span: prefix for nouns of class 5, preceding consonant initial stems
he, she, it; verb prefix for third person singular/class 1 (subject agreement marker)
it, they; verb prefix for classes 5 and 13 (subject agreement marker)
to; infinitive marker=class 5 prefix, used in purpose clauses
Ansú á ndáb, âboŋsɛn nsɔ́n ḿmī.
He returned home to prepare his work.
prefix marking future tense on verbs, merges with person and negative prefixes
of; associative marker for nouns of class 1
vocative marker (used before stems beginning with a high tone)
to, at, etc., general locative marker
of; associative marker for nouns of classes 5 and 13
vocative marker (used before stems beginning with a low tone)
he, she, it; verb prefix third person singular/class 1 (subject agreement marker), combined with future marker
She will go to the market.
that; particle introducing speech, third person singular
He said that he will be going.
verb suffix indicating past imperfective negative
verb suffix indicating past tense and imperfective aspect
Ane mod awóó abaa dé mbéb.
That man is wicked. Lit.: That man has a bad liver.
Bwɛl bê éʼwóó abaá á yə̌l.
That tree has honey on it.
He is sewing with a sewing machine.
He saw the leopard coming and cowered down.
He refused to give me his food./He was hiding the food from me.
their; possessive pronoun third person plural for nouns of classes 2, 8, 14 and 19
He peeped through the hole in the house.
He warmed his hands by the fire.
Abádté ediídiŋge á eʼsɛ́d éʼ ndáb.
He pasted the picture on the walls of the house.
He is the second to arrive at the hunted animal.
The holiday is about to end.
Bádɛ́n mé ámbīd boŋ désɔ̂l asɔ́l ahɔ́g.
Stand behind me so that we can enter together.
Bágéd échê ehɔ́b bwǎmbwam, baŋ ébɛl ké chéé éche éwémtɛ́né.
Make sure about the conversation so that you know what to do.
Eewóoʼɛ́ abám ádé áhágkɛ̄ páá áte.
He doesnʼt have a sheath in which to put his cutlass.
Nzumɛ́ aháŋgé mbód á abám dé eʼkɛ́.
Nzume has tethered the goat beside the fence.
Kɛ̌ épim á abám á ndyɛ̌.
Go and throw it at the edge of
He walked along the edge of the stream.
He walked along the edge of the stream.
He walked along the edge of the stream.
He walked along the edge of the stream.
He walked along the edge of the stream.
He walked along the edge of the stream.
He walked along the edge of the stream.
He walked along the edge of the stream.
He walked along the edge of the stream.
